title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Act establishes the Office of Environmental Education. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act (20 U.S.C. 5503) is amended to include a balanced and scientifically sound approach. The Office of Environmental Education shall have a headquarters staff of not more than 10 full-time equivalent employees. The Office of Environmental Education shall have a headquarters staff of not more than 10 full-time equivalent employees and be supported by 1 full-time equivalent employee in each Agency regional office. The Administrator may carry out activities directly or through awards of grants, cooperative agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3 amends the National Environmental Education Act by reducing the percentage of funding for environmental education grants and prohibiting the use of grants for lobbying activities. SEC. 4 focuses on environmental internships and fellowships. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking sections 7 through 11 and redesignating them as sections 7 through 10. Conforming amendments include updating the table of contents and references to the sections. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by updating various sections, such as changing references from section 8 to section 7, section 9 to section 8, section 9(d) to section 8(d), section 10(a) to subsection (a), and section 10(d) to section 9(d). The National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish the President's Environmental Youth Awards for students in grades K-12 with outstanding environmental projects. Additionally, an Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force are created. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to specify the composition of the Advisory Council, with members appointed by the Administrator representing various sectors. The Task Force membership requirements are also updated. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to update the composition of the Advisory Council and Task Force membership requirements. Membership on the Task Force is now open to representatives of any Federal agency engaged in environmental education, and the Advisory Council is required to hold biennial meetings on timely issues and issue a report with recommendations. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to update the composition of the Advisory Council and Task Force membership requirements. Membership on the Task Force is now open to representatives of any Federal agency engaged in environmental education. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and make conforming amendments to related sections. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and make related amendments to sections 3, 9, and 10. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and make related amendments to sections 3, 9, and 10, including increasing the number of directors on the Board and removing a condition on donations. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Appropriations include $10,000,000 for each year from 1997 to 2002 and necessary sums for 2003 to 2007. Limitations include allocating no more than 25% for the Office of Environmental Education and 25% for the environmental education and training program. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Appropriations include $10,000,000 for each year from 1997 to 2002 and necessary sums for 2003 to 2007. Limitations allocate funds for environmental education grants, the Foundation for Environmental Education, and administrative expenses. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of the Act.
